title: anaconda
content:
Anacondaone year ago, i heared anaconda when i learned python in oneline video tutorial. and how, what is anaconda, it is just a virtual environment of python. why i need it? i have python in my local machine! seems useless
today, i finally realized that it is a amazing tool. since i wrote a python script with python3, it runs perfect locally. however in the real environment(remote machine), i cannot run it. because remote machine is python2.6 and also cannot install modules oneline. i tried several ways: such as packing modules, compiling python3 from source. all failed!
finally, i remember it, yeah, anaconda! and it is really so good, it can be installed in different os without dependent error and includes all modules which i need. amazing!
features
easily in use

purely installed without dependence error in whatever os

include many modules what we used daily

multi different virtual environment, each of them without any relation

without any affect to local environment


installdownload from website, it has two choice:

anaconda: include 1500+ modules, especially scientific packages and 3 GB storage disk needed 
minianaconda: without scientific packages, but enough for daily usage and 400Mib storage disk needed

i download the minimal package
the installation in linux is easy

download package

grant priviledge and execute
chmod u+x Miniconda3-py39_4.9.2-Linux-x86_64.sh./Miniconda3-py39_4.9.2-Linux-x86_64.sh
step by step

note: 
   the place anaconda installed should be a folder that doesn’t exist

Do you accept the license terms? [yes|no][no] >>> yesMiniconda3 will now be installed into this location:/home/blueocean/miniconda3  - Press ENTER to confirm the location  - Press CTRL-C to abort the installation  - Or specify a different location below[/home/blueocean/miniconda3] >>> /home/blueocean/.local/apps/minicandaDo you wish the installer to initialize Miniconda3by running conda init? [yes|no][no] >>> yesmodified      `/home/blueocean/.zshrc`
reopen terminal or source the environment variables where conda’s config stores, in my case it is in ~/.zshrc 

disable auto enter conda base environment
in default conda will auto active when we start up a terminal. that’s not i want, so change it.
conda config --set auto_activate_base false# and checkconda config --show|grep base

usagefull document follow this page
login/logout environmentafter installation completes without error, we can reopen terminal or source the file where installation modified with source ~/.zshrc
~ » source .zshrc                                                                         (base) ~ »         

it is obviously that the promt changed, we can also modify prompt with --set env_prompt
conda config --set env_prompt '({conda})'

after source file, we enter the default base environment which was created while installing. we can list the environment that we have created with conda env list
(base) ~ » conda env list                                                                 # conda environments:#base                  *  /home/blueocean/.local/apps/minicanda

check conda version
(base) ~ » conda --version                                                               conda 4.9.2


if versions prior to 4.6

enter environment
source activate conda_env_name
exit environment
source deactivate


if versions higher than 4.6

enter environment
conda activate conda_env_name
exit environment
conda deactivate



create new environmentbefore we install packages, we need config download mirrors, without configure will lead to installation failed for slowly download speed.
conda config --add channels https://mirrors.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/anaconda/pkgs/mainconda config --add channels https://mirrors.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/anaconda/pkgs/freeconda config --add channels https://mirrors.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/anaconda/pkgs/rconda config --add channels https://mirrors.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/anaconda/pkgs/proconda config --add channels https://mirrors.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/anaconda/pkgs/msys2

if the channel added is wrong, we can remove it by
conda config --remove channels mirrors_url# such asconda config --remove channels https://mirrors.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/anaconda/pkgs/r

check channels config now
conda config --show channels

create environment 
# syntaxconda create --name conda_env_name install_module_name

when we don’t specify python version, conda will install the newest python version. if we want to use a different versin of python, for example python 2.6, simply create a new environment and specify the version of Python that you want.
conda create --name snowflakes python2.6

if we have multi modules need to be installed, we should write in one line to avoid depences missing.
# such as install pandas xlwt pathlib moduleconda create --name sky pandas xlwt pathlib

check new environment
conda env list

pack environmentwith conda-pack, we can pack environment to any other location and any other os.

note:
   os means the same platform, such as cannot pack one linux environment to windows

install conda-pack with conda
it is recommended to install conda-pack into base environment, since it can be used in all other sub environment
conda install conda-pack

pack environment
# pack into ./env_name.tar.gzconda pack --name env_name# pack into /specified/location/path/env_name.tar.gzconda pack --prefix /store/location/path# change out nameconda pack --output my_env_name.tar.gz

unpack environment
the condition we can use conda-pack is that there has a conda installed on the target machine.

note:
the place we unpack can be two parts:
1. under base environment `envs` floder
2. any other folder


# create a folder named the same as packagemkdir /environment/stored/env_name# or store it in default base envsmkdir /path/to/base/envs# extract packagetar -xzf env_name.tar.gz -C /path/to/create/folder# if not in base envs, activate environment, this will add env_name/bin to your pathsource env_name/bin/activate# if in base envs, activate environment with conda directoryconda activate env_name# unpack conda-unpack# deactivate if not in default base envs, this will remove it from you pathsource env_name/bin/deactivate# if in base envs, activate environment with conda directoryconda deactivate

title: anbox
content:
AnboxIn this article i will show you how to install anbox with snap and compare snap with flatpak.  anbox is a container-based software for running Android in linux. be different from virtual machine, anbox uses kernel module binder and ashmem to share and devide system source, thus it starts up very quickly.
snap vs flatpaksnap or flatpak is a cross platform package manager in different linux OS, which stores packages in a independent environment and improves security of system. whatever to say, both of them are not perfect as what i want. why i use it? i hope to install large size software in another disk partition but not the system tree in linux, if there is a need to reinstall the system, i don’t need to reinstall the software itself, one thing i need  is installing the snap package.
disadvantages:

snap doesn’t allow to specify package location, so we need to mount bind to that location.
flatpak doesn’t have above disadvantages but the software size is too large and has less software than snap.

i choose snap at last, the main reason in this case is that only snap has anbox package.
change kernelkernel module
default linux kernel doesn’t has anbox needed modules, a simple way is installing a linux-zen kernel
pacman -S linux-zen

then we need edit /boot/grub/grub.cfg file, adding a sub entry with the new kernel. once we boot in grub, we can choose the  new kernel by hand.
menuentry 'Arch Linux, with Linux-zen linux' --class arch --class gnu-linux --class gnu --class os $menuentry_id_option 'gnulinux-linux-advanced-20f94885-274b-4a99-b067-a0adf09a1723' {	.	.	.	echo	'Loading Linux-zen linux ...'	linux	/boot/vmlinuz-linux-zen root=UUID=20f94885-274b-4a99-b067-a0adf09a1723 rw  loglevel=3 quiet	echo	'Loading initial ramdisk ...'	initrd	/boot/initramfs-linux-zen.img}



snap installsnap package location change
snap has no method to specify package location, but we can use mount bind to mount other location to the package folder
# snap package folder is  /var/lib/snapd# before install snap, mount folder to that foldermkdir /home/healer/Public/snapdsudo mkdir /var/lib/snapdsudo mount --bind /home/healer/Public/snapd /var/lib/snapd

above command will make effect until reboot, so we need write mount command to /etc/fstab in order to auto mount after system reboot.
sudo vim /etc/fstab/home/healer/Public/snapd	/var/lib/snapd	none	bind	0 0

install snap
paru -S snapd

start snap
sudo systemctl enable --now snapd.socket

add hosts entry
by default the speed snap downloads is slow, we need add dns to hosts file
echo "151.101.62.217  fastly.cdn.snapcraft.io" >> /etc/hosts

some snap commands
# updatesnap refresh# searchsnap find package-name# installsnap install package-name# uninstallsnap uninstall package-name# list installed package snap list





anbox installwe can find all snap packages in this website
snap install --devmode --beta anbox

run anbox first time
/var/lib/snapd/snap/bin/anbox launch --package=org.anbox.appmgr --component=org.anbox.appmgr.AppViewActivity

after system reboot we can start anbox via system launch app or dmenu
install apk in anboxby default, anbox has no app store in it, so we need install a app store to it. the method we use is adb
# adb is part of android-tools packagesudo pacman -S android-tools

# such as download a coolan apk from web browser and install it to anboxadb install Coolapk-11.4.2-2109281-coolapk-app-sign.apk





flatpakinstall
at last, i want to record the flatpak installation and usage. in a fact that flatpak is really easy to install or use.
# installsudo pacman -S flatpak

add repo
we need to know that the package store location is defined by --user parameter. however the parameter takes effect only when we specify the user repo before. by default our repository is system, so we need add user repository manually.
# systemflatpak remote-add --if-not-exists flathub https://dl.flathub.org/repo/flathub.flatpakrepo# userflatpak remote-add --user --if-not-exists flathub https://dl.flathub.org/repo/flathub.flatpakrepo# check repoflatpak remotes

usage
find support packages and package install commands in this website
# eg:# install firefox in user locationflatpak install --user flathub org.mozilla.firefox

user package location is ~/.local/share/flatpak
# start with commandflatpak run org.mozilla.firefox# or directlyfirefox# or find it in package launch manager such as dmenu or rofi

some commands
# updateflaptak update# search flatpak search package-name# installflatpak install package-name# uninstallflatpak uninstall package-name# list installed packageflatpak list

title: ansible
content:
Ansibleansible is a software without the concept of server or client, but it can do the job of cluster management. the magic is that it uses ssh to connect to other os, that’s it. it can do all of the thing what you do in hosts.
features
no client
via ssh
moduled
yaml file
parallel

function
software deployment, install software via ansible
configuration management, configure system via ansible
software provisioning

installin centos
yum install epel-release -yyum install ansible -y

in archlinux
pacman -S ansible



syntaxansible host_pattern action# oransible-playbook host_pattern



inventory fileif only one ip address to connect, we can write it directly. if more than one ip address we can write it in a special file called inventory file.
inventory file is a file that ansible store variable messages(such as ip, login user name, password etc). the default file is /etc/ansible/hosts. we can simplily put ip in the file, however the way much better is group hosts.
[group_name]host_ip_1host_ip_2host_ip_3

eg:
[testCentos]192.168.31.114

then we can list all host in this file by
# ansible all --list-hosts  hosts (1):    192.168.31.114

if we know group name, we can specify group to show
# ansible testCentos --list-hosts  hosts (1):    192.168.31.114



we can also specify ourself inventory file. there are two methords.

change the default location in /etc/ansible/ansible.cfg
inventory      = /any/other/file/location
specify by parameter
make personal inventory file
echo "[testCentos]192.168.31.114" >> ip_addr.txt

use --inventory to define.
ansible --inventory ./ip_addr.txt all --list-hosts

modulemodule in ansible is command collection. we can find module help by
ansible-doc module_name

such as find shell module usage 
ansible-doc shell

check total module in local machine
ansible-doc --list | wc -l

we can use those modules by --module-name.
Ad-hocAd-hoc commands in ansible means those one-line commands run in hosts. it is easy, simple without multi tasks to run. so if we just wanna to do a simple task, we can write Ad-hoc. for example check connection with machine.
one ip can write directly
ansible 192.168.31.114 --module-name ping



# ansible all --module-name pingThe authenticity of host '192.168.31.114 (192.168.31.114)' can't be established.ECDSA key fingerprint is SHA256:LzEdo+P7rgs1gJgODVWJaPFgHKk+Zl8/9ULzGN6z/8Q.Are you sure you want to continue connecting (yes/no/[fingerprint])? no192.168.31.114 | UNREACHABLE! => {    "changed": false,    "msg": "Failed to connect to the host via ssh: Host key verification failed.",    "unreachable": true}

if we have ever not connect to the hosts, it may get an error msg, at this time we need to type password by adding --ask-pass
# ansible all --module-name ping --ask-passSSH password: 192.168.31.114 | FAILED! => {    "msg": "Using a SSH password instead of a key is not possible because Host Key checking is enabled and sshpass does not support this.  Please add this host's fingerprint to your known_hosts file to manage this host."}

okay, it says that the default config has enabled host key check, so we need disable it
vim /etc/ansible/ansible.cfg# uncomment to disable host key checkhost_key_checking = False

then, run command again
# ansible all --module-name ping --ask-passSSH password: 192.168.31.114 | SUCCESS => {    "ansible_facts": {        "discovered_interpreter_python": "/usr/bin/python"    },    "changed": false,    "ping": "pong"}

yes, we get it. "changed": false above means we don’t change anything in remote machine.

Note:

instead of typing password every times, the recommand way is configuring ansible machine connects to remote machine without password (put ansible ssh public key to remote machine).
if we don’t specify a login user, it will use ansible machine login user name, we can use --user user_name to specify other login user.
we can use --ask-pass to input login user password


# ansible testCentos --ask-pass --user root --module-name shell --args "ip -c -br a"           SSH password: 192.168.31.114 | CHANGED | rc=0 >>lo               UNKNOWN        127.0.0.1/8 ::1/128 enp0s3           UP             192.168.31.114/24 fe80::cd8e:43e4:458d:9ab3/64


Note:
command module can only be used in one command with its parameter, one liner command(several commands connected with &&, ;, |, >) need use shell module.

sometimes, we cannot login directly with root user, but we need root priviledge. there are two ways:

 if the login user has sudo priviledge

   ansible all --user login_user --ask-pass --become --become-user root --ask-become-pass --module-name shell --args "systemctl restart network"


if the login user has no sudo priviledge, then we need to change to root user with su
ansible all --user login_user --ask-pass --become --become-user root --become-method su --ask-become-pass --module-name shell --args "systemctl restart network"

variable of user name and passwordokay, as we write above, if we want to execute some command in remote machine, a login user and password is needed. we can use --user and --ask-pass then typing in terminal, and there is another way without typing.
ansible has already defined this variables. the thing that we need to do is sign a value to it. there are four  ways.

write in inventory file.
if we only specify a group login info, we can use [group_name:vars]. if we define global login info, we can use [all:vars].
[testCentos]192.168.31.114[testCentos:vars]ansible_ssh_user=testansible_ssh_pass=123ansible_become_pass=123456

then execute without password input
ansible --inventory ./hosts all --module-name shell --args "ps -ef|grep sshd" --become --become-user root --become-method su
write in playbook file playbook.yml
touch playbook.yml

---- hosts: testCentos  vars:    ansible_ssh_user: test    ansible_ssh_pass: 123    ansible_become_pass: 123456  gather_facts: no  tasks:    - name: copy file to remote      become: yes      become_user: root      become_method: su      copy:      	src: /tmp/hosts   	dest: /root

then execute
ansible --inventory ./hosts playbook.yml
write in a seperate variable file
in this way , we need to import the file in playbook
# touch ansible_vars.yml---ansible_ssh_user=testansible_ssh_pass=123ansible_become_pass=123456

# import variable file in playbook- hosts: testCentos  vars_files:    - ./ansible_vars.yml  gather_facts: no  tasks:    - name: check sshd status      become: yes      become_user: root      become_method: su      shell: ps -ef|grep sshd|grep -v grep
write in specify floder group_vars
in the way, we write a yaml variable’s file in group_vars and named with the same group name as inventory file.  and we don’t need to import the variable file by this way.
# in ansible working folder make a folder named group_varsmkdir group_vars# in group_vars, make group name file and write variablestouch testCentosecho "---ansible_ssh_user=testansible_ssh_pass=123ansible_become_pass=123456" >> testCentos

note: if we wanna to define global variable, we need to make a file named all



Note:
become_method: su is very useful , default is use sudo method, however most of time we are not in sudo group. but with su method, we login with root then execute command.


vars: collection of variables
name: what kind of thing the task does
ansible_ssh_user: login user name
ansible_ssh_pass: login user password
ansible_become_pass: root user password
gather_facts: whether will we collect remote machine info, don’t gather saves lot of time
become: change user or not 
become_user:  default 
use sudo to run the tasks
become_method: su: don’t use sudo, login with root. it is very userful when we have no sudo priviledge 
shell: run linux shell command.

playbookwhat is playbook? playbook is a set of Ad-hoc tasks writing in a yaml file. the method to execute playbook different from Ad-hoc. use ansible-playbook instead of ansible
# such as i make a playbook file named playbook.ymlansible-playbook playbook.yml

for example
# hosts file[testCentos]192.168.31.114

# playbook---- hosts: testCentos  gather_facts: no  become: yes  become_user: root  become_method: su  vars:    ansible_ssh_user: test    ansible_ssh_pass: 123    ansible_become_pass: 123456    pkgname: nginx  tasks:    - name: add nginx resource      shell: rpm -Uvh http://nginx.org/packages/centos/7/noarch/RPMS/nginx-release-centos-7-0.el7.ngx.noarch.rpm    - name: install {{pkgname}}      yum: name={{pkgname}} state=present      notify:        - restart {{pkgname}}    - name: start at boot      systemd: name={{pkgname}} state=started enabled=yes    - name: open firewalld 80 port      shell: |        firewall-cmd --zone=public --permanent --add-port=80/tcp        firewall-cmd --reload  handlers:    - name: restart {{pkgname}}      systemd: name={{pkgname}} state=restarted

execute
ansible-playbook --inventroy hosts playbook.yml

then we can visit nginx web page at http://192.168.31.114
above we used modules: 
​    shell to execute shell command 
​    yum to download nginx 
​    systemd to start and enable nginx auto start.
we also used notify: when task execute successfully, it will raise a notify.
we also used handlers: to receive notify and execute others
we also used vars: it anounced serveral variables, and we can call it with {{variable_name}}

note:
we may say we can use shell instead of yum or systemd module, yeah, you can do it like that, but the best way is using available modules.
use | to combine multi line into one line. it is useful to execute more than one command.

conditionwe use when condition to do logical judge. register to store return value. failed_when:no to continue when return value isn’t true(in default task will stop when return value is false).
as we write above, if we execute again, it may failed because we already have a nginx repo. so what should we do? we need to check whether exists nginx repo. if exists then jump
...  tasks:    - name: check whether nginx repo added      shell: ls /etc/yum.repos.d/ | grep nginx      register: repo      failed_when: no    - name: add nginx resource      shell: rpm -Uvh http://nginx.org/packages/centos/7/noarch/RPMS/nginx-release-centos-7-0.el7.ngx.noarch.rpm      when: repo.rc == 1...



loopwe can use loop syntax in ansible playbook. use with_items to loop list. the variable default 
---- hosts: testCentos  gather_facts: no  become: yes  become_user: root  become_method: su  tasks:    - name: install software      yum: name={{ item }} state=present      with_items:        - curl        - wget

ansible » ansible-playbook --inventory hosts playbook.yml                                                                         PLAY [testCentos] **************************************************************************************************************************************************************************TASK [install software] ********************************************************************************************************************************************************************changed: [192.168.31.114] => (item=['curl', 'wget'])PLAY RECAP *********************************************************************************************************************************************************************************192.168.31.114             : ok=1    changed=1    unreachable=0    failed=0    skipped=0    rescued=0    ignored=0   



tagswith tags, we can specify which task to be execute in shell command

write tag at the end of task
---- hosts: testCentos  gather_facts: no  become: yes  become_user: root  become_method: su  tasks:    - name: install curl      yum: name=curl state=present      tags:        - curl    - name: install wget      yum: name=wget state=present      tags:        - wget
specify which task should be execute by using --tags tag_name


  ansible » ansible-playbook --inventory hosts playbook.yml --tags wget                                                               PLAY [testCentos] **************************************************************************************************************************************************************************      TASK [install wget] ************************************************************************************************************************************************************************   ok: [192.168.31.114]      PLAY RECAP *********************************************************************************************************************************************************************************   192.168.31.114             : ok=1    changed=0    unreachable=0    failed=0    skipped=0    rescued=0    ignored=0   

blockblock can help us execute multi task in one condition.
---- hosts: testCentos  gather_facts: no  become: yes  become_user: root  become_method: su  tasks:    - name: check network      shell: ping www.baidu.com -c 3      register: connect    - name: install curl      block:        - yum: name=curl state=present        - yum: name=wget state=present      when: connect.rc == 0





Ansible Toweransible tower is a paid software(not free) aiming provide an easy usage gui for ansible. before install, we need to know the minimal machine requirement

cpu: 2 core
mem: 4Gib
software size: almost 2 Gib

installdownload tar.gz it from this website, then extract
tar -xzf ansible-tower-setup-3.6.0-1.tar.gz -C /opt

before installing, we need to add password to inventory configure file
cd /opt/ansible-tower-setup-3.6.0-1# for example, not exactly the same as below. but need to fill all empty passwordadmin_password='ansible'pg_password='ansible'rabbitmq_password='ansible'

then install with a shell script. may be a coffee time
./setup.sh

when all tasks execute successfully. we can visit the web page with https://ip

the default user name is admin, and the password is what you typed in inventory file.
license hackas we mentioned before, ansible tower is a paid software, so we cannot login the main page. however there is a way to hack the license and making it valid forever.
# add epel repoyum -y install epel-release# install pipyum -y install python-pip# download reverse compile modulepip install uncompyle6# change to license diretorycd /var/lib/awx/venv/awx/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tower_license# reverse compile init fileuncompyle6 __init__.pyc > __init__.py# change reversed compile filevi __init__.py# at line 84, remove last character "L"# after line 89, add a new line with "return True"# compile itpython -m py_compile __init__.pypython -O -m py_compile __init__.py# restart ansible-tower-serviceansible-tower-service restart

file __init__.py changed like this:

then we can login the main page, and check it’s license.

the default main page of ansible tower looks like this

templatea template to execute command in remote and check remote service status
ip_info
[client1]192.168.31.197192.168.31.196[client2]192.168.31.182[client1:vars]ansible_ssh_user=ngusansible_ssh_pass=123ansible_become_pass=123456[client2:vars]ansible_ssh_user=dbaansible_ssh_pass=321ansible_become_pass=654321

yaml file: playbook.yaml
---- hosts: all  gather_facts: no  become: yes  become_user: root  become_method: su  tasks:      - name: install client        shell: {{command here}}        register: install_status        failed_when: no        tags:          - install      - name: check client status        shell: ps -ef |grep service_name        tags:           - check...

run with command
## installansible-playbook --inventory ip_info playbook.yaml --tag install## checkansible-playbook --inventory ip_info playbook.yaml --tag check

title: ed
content:
EDed是一个unix默认的编辑器，是操作系统自带的编辑器，如果在某些场景下没有vim编辑器，那么ed就可以派上用场的
大多数ed的命令和vim一致
simple open / quit file
# ed without parameter open a text buffered# ed with a filename open a file and make changes to the copy of file buffered file.txt# exit ed with warnq# exit without warnQ# write changes to filew# open content to filef filename# open content file and write to filef filenamew# orw filename



prompt/command mode and input mode
while opening file, will locate in the last line of file with prompt mode
# default will enter prompt mode, in this mode we can execute command# `P` toggles prompt on or off P# trun display error message onH# !command allow us to execute shell command!command# read output of command and write to bufferr !command# enter input mode: `a` append; `i` insert; `c` changeaic# `.` exit input mode.



, usage
# `,` means all lines# print last line, in default, will show the last linep# print all lines,p# delete one lined# delete all lines,d





# usage
# `#` in prompt mode means ignore# this line will be ignored# `#` in input mode means nothing but a character



num to locate
# in default, will locate the last line, num will locate other line# 1 locate line 11# enter will locate to end line one by one# move option after num2s/hell/hello# move current line to line 1m0# move line 10 to line 1 and print10m0p



line address
.    #The current line (address) in the buffer.$    #The last line in the buffer.n    #The nth line in the buffer, where n is a number in the range '0,$'.+n   #The nth next line, where n is a non-negative number.-n   #The nth previous line, where n is a non-negative number.+    #The next line. This is equivalent to '+1' and may be repeated with cumulative effect.-    #The previous line. This is equivalent to '-1' and may be repeated with cumulative effect.,    #The first through last lines in the buffer. This is equivalent to the address range '1,$'.;    #The current through last lines in the buffer. This is equivalent to the address range '.;$'./re/ #The next line containing the regular expression re. The search wraps to the beginning of the 			  buffer and continues down to the current line, if necessary.?re? #The previous line containing the regular expression re. The search wraps to the end of the buffer 	 and continues up to the current line, if necessary.'x   #The apostrophe-x character pair addresses the line previously marked by a 'k' (mark) command,  		 where 'x' is a lower case letter from the portable character set '[a-z]'.



other important command
# print line with line number,n# undo changesu# copy current line to specified linet2# show content with keyword position. eg:display content from starting with `#` to now.?^#?,.p# global search1,$g/<pattern>/p# or,g/<pattern>/p

title: archlinux
content:
archlinuxThis document includes all the knowledges of using archlinux, from basic installing to daily using, all in one.
[TOC]
base system installfirst of all, we need to install the system. take it ease, step by  step, and you can own it.
adjust console fontmay be the default console font is too small, we can change it temporarily and make it much bigger.
cd /usr/share/kbd/consolefontssetfont iso01-12x22.psfu.gz

connect network
if plug in the cabel, use dhcpcd to get a ip address.

if use wireless, use iwctl to config the netwrok
# the iwd.server is running by defaultiwctl# list network interfacedevice list# start scaning networkstation device scan# show scan resultstation device get-networks# connect to one wifistation device connect ssid# get dynamic ip addressdhcpcd

change mirror listmodify /etc/pacman.d/mirrorlist file, move China mirror list to the head.

note: this configure will sync to new installed system.

head /etc/pacman.d/mirrorlist## ChinaServer = http://mirrors.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/archlinux/$repo/os/$archServer = https://mirrors.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/archlinux/$repo/os/$archServer = http://mirrors.ustc.edu.cn/archlinux/$repo/os/$archServer = https://mirrors.ustc.edu.cn/archlinux/$repo/os/$archServer = http://mirrors.163.com/archlinux/$repo/os/$archServer = http://mirrors.bfsu.edu.cn/archlinux/$repo/os/$archServer = https://mirrors.bfsu.edu.cn/archlinux/$repo/os/$arch

update system clockenable ntp to ensure the system clock is accurate.
timedatectl set-ntp true

partition diskwe can use tools like cfdisk ,parted to parted disk. whatever tool we choose, there are some things need to be done the same.

format entire disk with gpt table
one efi partition to install grub


note: efi partition cannot used as lvm part, lvm can only be recognized after grub loading.

lvm example: 

esp: 100M
root(lvm): 30G
home(lvm):  last space

parted /dev/nvme0n1 mktable gptparted /dev/nvme0n1 mkpart fat 0% 100Mibparted /dev/nvme0n1 mkpart ext4 100Mib 100%pvcreate /dev/nvme0n1p2vgcreate linux /dev/nvme0n1p2lvcreate -L 30G linux -n root lvcreate -l +100%FREE linux -n homemkfs.fat -F 32 /dev/nvme0n1p1mkfs.ext4 /dev/linux/rootmkfs.ext4 /dev/linux/home

mount partition and install system# mount root and home partitionmount /dev/linux/root /mntmkdir /mnt/home && mount /dev/linux/home /mnt/home# chroot mnt and install base systempacstrap /mnt base linux linux-firmware lvm2 vim

generate mount configure
note: efi partition not need to be mount.

genfstab -U /mnt >> /mnt/etc/fstab

chroot new systemarch-chroot /mnt

timezoneln -sf /usr/share/zoneinfo/Asia/Shanghai /etc/localtimehwclock --systohc

system languageuncomment /etc/locale.gen  with en_us.UTF-8 and zh_CN.UTF-8 then run
locale-gen# set default system languageecho "LANG=en_US.UTF-8" > /etc/locale.conf

network# add hostnameecho "notebook" > /etc/hostname# add hostsecho "127.0.0.1    localhost::1        localhost127.0.1.1    hostname.localdomain    hostname" >> /etc/hosts

initramfs
note: if we don’t use lvm, this step can be ignored.

edit /etc/mkinitcpio.conf, add lvm2 between block and filesystems
mkinitcpio -P

install netwrok toolwe can choose iwd or netctl to configure network

iwd

pacman -S iwd dhcpcdsystemctl enable iwd


netctl

pacman -S netctl wpa_supplicant dialog  dhcpcd

install grubfirst mount efi partition to /boot/efi
mkdir /boot/efimount /dev/nvme0n1p1 /boot/efipacman -S grub efibootmgrgrub-install --target=x86_64-efi --efi-directory=/boot/efi --bootloader-id=GRUB --removablegrub-mkconfig -o /boot/grub/grub.cfg

set root passwdpasswd root

umount and rebootexit and umount -R /mntreboot

general configurethe step below is general configure, that is to say it’s basic and cannot be ignored.
connect network
we can use iwd to set wifi connection, only need using dhcpcd to get a dynamic ip address
static ip
create a config file  /etc/iwd/main.conf to enable static network config by adding
cat /etc/iwd/main.conf[General]EnableNetworkConfiguration=true

add static ip address config to wifi_name.psk file under /var/lib/iwd
cat >> /var/lib/iwd/qiyue.psk[IPv4]Address=192.168.31.31Netmask=255.255.255.0Gateway=192.168.31.1
if we use netctl(wifi/ethernet), we can use a gui tool named wifi-menu to connect network
sudo wifi-menu

when we connect correct there will be a configure file in /etc/netctl, in order to auto connect network, we need enable it.
cd /etc/netctl# it must be file name not localtion path and without super priviledgenetctl enable confirure_file_name

static ip
sudo cp /etc/netctl/examples/wireless-wpa-static /etc/netctlDescription='A simple WPA encrypted wireless connection using a static IP'Interface=wlo1Connection=wirelessSecurity=wpaESSID='wifi-essid' # modifyKey='password' # modifyIP=staticAddress='192.168.0.104/24' # modifyGateway='192.168.0.1'    # modifyDNS=('114.114.114.114') # modify

some command of netctl
netctl disable wireless-wpa-static-oldnetctl enable wireless-wpa-staticnetctl restart wireless-wpa-static

install some softwareif there comes some error message shows cannot find package, we need to config China repository first.

man page
pacman -S man-db man-pages texinfo
base-devel
it includes sudo, gcc, make, sed, grep, which and etc usual command
pacman -S base-devel
install doas or sudo
pacman -S sudopacman -S doas

then create a file /etc/doas.conf and write something to it
echo "permit nopass :wheel" > /etc/doas.conf
xmonad window manager
xmonad window manager uses xterm by default.
pacman -S xmonad xmonad-contrib xmobar xterm
poybar
i use it with xmonad as default status bar
pacman -S polybar
input method
install all of packages of fcitx5-im, fcitx5-material-color is the skin which really likes windows 10
pacman -S fcitx5-im fcitx5-material-color fcitx5-rime
transparent tools
transset-df can transparent the xterm
yay -S transset-df
animate action
picom has some good effect like fade in fade out and etc. and aur’s picom-jonaburg-git has motion effect
yay -S picom-jonaburg-git



package search tool
we can use dmenu or rofi, i use dmenu much more, but rofi can help me to find how many applications i have ever installed and which one should i launch once a time forgot its name with some keywords.
pacman -S dmenu rofi
font
proper font will make some software works well like xterm and polybar
# the font can show icons in terminal, and font for vscode# Cascadia and Firacode become my favorite fonts now, even use it as system application fontpacman -S nerd-fonts-iosevka nerd-fonts-fira-code nerd-fonts-cascadia-code# the two fonts can show chinese and korean proper in polybarpacman -S adobe-source-han-sans-cn-fonts adobe-source-han-sans-kr-fonts 
notify tool
it can show notify message in desktop with highly configurable.
pacman -S dunst
clip tool
it is a clip tool with great useage, such as clip standard output, one file even though an image
pacman -S xclip
youdao dictionary
i have wrote a shell translate copy sentense which depends on this
pacman -S ydcv-rs-git
screenshot
useful screenshot tool
pacman -S flameshot
file manager
w3m is a plug in to show photo
pacman -S ranger w3m
download tool
pacman -S wget curl
audio and video player
pacman -S mpg123 mplayer
performance monitor
pacman -S glances htop neofetch# htim is a replace of htop with vim typle keybing, after install it, type htop as usualyay -S htim
browser
pacman -S firefox
writer
# use marktext-git instead of typora, since typora is not open sourcepacman -S marktext-git
code
pacman -S visual-studio-code-bin
screen capture
pacman -S obs-studio
sql client tool
pacman -S dbeaver
stickypad
pacman -S xpad
chat
pacman -S skypeforlinux-stable-bin
gui dialog tool
pacman -S yad
simulate
pacman -S xdotool
cli music player 
pacman -S cmus
chinese date
pacman -S cdate
cpu information
pacman -S cpufetch
image viewer
pacman -S gthumb
wire sniff tool
pacman -S wireshark
fake like hackers tool
cmatrix no-more-secrets-git
analysis disk usage
pacman -S ncdu

add userinstall zsh shell first
sudo pacman -S zsh oh-my-zsh-git

add user with wheel group and zsh as default shell
useradd -m -G wheel -s /bin/zsh username

set passwd
passwd username

then adjust priviledges, such as sudo priviledge, run command without password
# uncomment below in /etc/sudoers%wheel ALL=(ALL) ALL%wheel ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD: ALL

install xorgpacman -S xorg

in order to use startx to login to gui, we need to install xorg-xinit
pacman -S xorg-xinit

videothere comes three choice: 

intel with video card integrated
nvidia indepedent
amd video driver

if we use intel video card, we need to install intel drive
pacman -S xf86-video-intel# install package to adjust screen backlight, only intel workspacman -S xorg-xbacklight# we can also adjust screen backlight by hand, only intel worksvim /sys/class/backlight/intel_backlight

if we use nvidia video card, we need to install nvidia drive
pacman -S nvidia

amd gpu
pacman -S xf86-video-amdgpu

audiosudo pacman -S pulseaudio pulseaudio-alsa pamixer

when we installed those software, we can also not get voice, because it is mute by default. so we need enable it
pamixer --unmute

personal configurewhy it is personal? because there are too many choice for user to choose, and i myself use the system serveral years and have wrote a shell script to copy the old configure file to the system without configure it step by step. so i will describe it in two part.

one is auto config
another is step by step

auto config all my backup file locate in ~/Data/linux, so i need to copy old data to new machine. there are several ways to do the thing, such as a usb drive, use scp, startup a ftp in old machine…
and find a script named filesync in linux/.local/bin which we copied from old machine. and run:
./filesync install

 most of things will be done automaticly.
step by stepthe section below will show you how to config system step by step.
install AUR package installerusing yay or paru we can download software in AUR. and suggest use paru, because it can search both pacman and aur at the same time.
pacman -S paru# pacman -S yay

add China repositorypacman repository
write info to /etc/pacman.conf
[archlinuxcn]Server = https://mirrors.aliyun.com/archlinuxcn/$arch

then refresh the database
pacman -Sy

we don’t need to install chinese keyring right now, just install it while there is a message shows we need to import some keyring.
pacman -S archlinuxcn-keyring

aur repository
# if use yay to download aur packageyay --aururl "https://aur.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn" --save

this will create yay config in ~/.config/yay/config.json
# can check config with commandsyay -P -g

default location configwhen we use xorg, there is a way to config where the data to be stored. even though not all the software follow the rules, but it is much better than no.
added to ~/.pam_environment
# environment variable to set xdg base directoryXDG_CONFIG_HOME=/home/blueocean/.configXDG_CACHE_HOME=/home/blueocean/.cacheXDG_DATA_HOME=/home/blueocean/.local/shareXDG_DATA_DIRS=/usr/local/share:/usr/shareXDG_CONFIG_DIRS=/etc/xdg

fcitx5 configurein order to make fcitx5 works well, there are several variable to be configed in ~/.pam_environment
# environment variable for fcitx5INPUT_METHOD  DEFAULT=fcitx5GTK_IM_MODULE DEFAULT=fcitx5QT_IM_MODULE  DEFAULT=fcitx5XMODIFIERS    DEFAULT=\@im=fcitx5

add startup command to ~/.xinitrc file :fcitx5 & 
short keys: ctrl +alt +h  :enable/disable completion
if not simple chinese, use “ctrl+`” to change
xmonad configcopy configure file xmonad.hs  to ~/.xmonad/
then compile it:
xmonad --recompile

write start xmonad command to ~/.xinitrc
# if home directory has no .xinitrc then copy [ ! -f ~/.xinitrc ] && cp /etc/X11/xinit/xinitrc ~/.xinitrc# write to the end of the fileexec xmonad    

polybar configif there has no configure file, we can download configure from website
[ ! -f ~/.config/polybar/config ] && touch ~/.config/polybar/config

add start command in ~/.xinitrc
sh ~/.config/polybar/launch.sh

disable touchpadif we have a touchpad and don’t wanna use, we can disable it
first of all, install the command:
pacman -S xorg-xinput

add below to ~/.xinitrc to disable it
xinput | grep Touchpad | grep -E '=[0-9]{2}' -o | grep -E '[0-9]{2}' -o | xargs xinput disable

cursor stylemake sure xsetroot tools has been installed
pacman -S xorg-xsetroot

write below to ~/.xinitrc
xsetroot -cursor_name left_ptr

window effectmake sure picom has been installed, then write below to ~/.xinitrc
picom  --experimental-backends --config .config/picom/picom.conf -b

xterm transparentmake sure transset-df has been installed, then write below to ~/.zshrc. we can change transparent with -m parameter.
[ -n "$XTERM_VERSION" ] && transset-df -m 0.95 --id "$WINDOWID" --dec 0.1 >/dev/null

ntfs file system recognizein order to recognize windows file system, the tool need to be installed. and without it we cannot modify windows file by normal user.
pacman -S ntfs-3g# mount examplemount -t ntfs-3g /dev/sdaX /mnt

home directorywith xdg-user-dirs add “well known” user directories in /home/user
pacman -S xdg-user-dirs

then run xdg-user-dirs-update to product
xdg-user-dirs-update

fat partition recognizein order to mount fat partition or use mkfs.fat format a disk, we need to install dosfstools first.
pacman -S dosfstools

other settingssome configure which seems not very important.
grub theme
gnome look or pacman
   download from the web site or install by pacman and mv to /boot/grub/theme directory
unzip arch-silence-master.zip                    mv arch-silence-master /boot/grub/theme/    

   now tell grub use the new theme, modify /etc/default/grub    
GRUB_THEME="/boot/grub/themes/arch-silence-master/theme/theme.txt"

   rebuild grub.cfg
grub-mkcofig -o /boot/grub/grub.cfg
git hub
   download from website, unzip and change directory to it and run
sudo ./install.sh -b -t tela

   
   uninstall run sudo ./install.sh -r -t tela


show boot messagein default the boot message is hidden, we can make it showing again.modify /etc/default/grub, remove quiet flag
GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT="loglevel=3"

rebuild grub.cfg
grub-mkconfig -o /boot/grub/grub.cfg

coloize pacmanin default the search result of pacman has no colors, we can change it. modify /etc/pacman.conf, uncomment color
colorlsit is a colorized ls command which can show icons (make sure u have patched font with graph support. such as nerd-fonts-iosevka)
# it is writed in rubepacman -S ruby# then use gem which ruby package manager install colorlsgem install colorls# follow install output config environment. such as add to .zshrcsource $(dirname $(gem which colorls))/tab_complete.sh# add path to /etc/profileappend_path '/home/blueocean/.local/share/gem/ruby/2.7.0/bin'

alias ls to colorls
# in .zshrcalias ls="colorls"# make effectsource /etc/profilesource ~/.zshrc


if ruby upgrades, run gem install colorls to upgrade colorls also.
bluetoothinstall base package
use bluetooth to connect device. intall package first
pacman -S bluez

provide cli tool
pacman -S bluez-utils

provide sounds for bluetooth
pacman -S pulseaudio-bluetooth

add user to lp group
it is needed to add user to lp group
usermod -a -G lp `whoami`

start bluetooth
check whether or not driver has been launched
lsmod | grep btusb

if not launched by hand
modprobe btusb

launch service, a reboot needed
systemctl enable bluetooth.servicesystemctl start bluetooth.service


note: we need enable bluetooth to start up automaticly, otherwise there will be a error msg of failed

connect devices the first time
bluetoothctlagent KeyboardOnlydefault-agentpower onscan onpair xxxxconnect xxxx

a paired device can be connect directory
# show paired devicesdevices# then connectconnect xxxx

adjust video fan speedmake sure nvidia-settings has been installed already.
# enable fan speed adjustnvidia-xconfig --cool-bits=4# then add below to ~/.xinitrc, replace n with the fan speed percentage. such as 10nvidia-settings -a "[gpu:0]/GPUFanControlState=1" -a "[fan:0]/GPUTargetFanSpeed=n"

cursor themefull document can visit arch wiki page.
the default cursor theme is bad, i need to change it. before start up, i need to make it clearly there are 3 part should be changed

xdg settting for X11
gtk theme setting
terminal setting

first download cursor theme you liked in this website
xdg setting
# create ~/.icons foldermkdir ~/.icons# extract theme folder to ~/.iconstar -xzf theme.tar.gz -C ~/.icons# create theme configure filemkdir ~/.icons/defaulttouch ~/.icons/default/index.themeecho "[icon theme]Inherits=oreo_spark_blue_cursors" > ~/.icons/default/index.theme

gtk setting
# create theme config filetouch ~/.config/gtk-3.0/settings.iniecho "[Settings]gtk-cursor-theme-name=oreo_spark_blue_cursors" > ~/.config/gtk-3.0/settings.ini# polybar use gtk-2.0, so we need copy above setting to gtk2 foldercp ~/.config/gtk-3.0/settings.ini ~/.config/gtk-2.0/settings.ini

terminal setting
# write this in ~/.XresourcesXcursor.theme: oreo_spark_blue_cursorsXcursor.size: 16

make it effect
xrdb ~/.Xresources

then relogin desktop
gtk application theme and icon themeit is a long time for google, and cannot find how to set system application theme and icon theme. finally i get it.
First, we need to know there are two different frames in our application:

GTK style
QT style

it depends on what kind of language the application to be wrote. not depends on our theme chooseing.
Second, we need to know there are there kind of themes we can download:

application theme. the frame of application which stores in ~/.themes or /usr/share/themes
icon theme, the icon of application which stores in ~/.icons or /usr/share/icons
cursor theme, cursor style which stores in ~/.icons or /usr/share/icons

I follow wiki page to configure themes:

download theme from this website

then extract gtk theme in~/.themes. 
extract icon theme in ~/.icons
tar -xJf Downloads/WhiteSur-light.tar.xz -C ~/.themes

tar -xJf 01-WhiteSur.tar.xz -C ~/.icons
edit two files

Note:
i find a more beautiful font rather than Cantarell
use CaskaydiaCove Nerd Font 10 instead of Cantarell 11

gtk2 application need to edit file /usr/share/gtk-2.0/gtkrc or .config/gtk-2.0/gtkrc
cat /usr/share/gtk-2.0/gtkrc gtk-icon-theme-name = "WhiteSur-light"gtk-theme-name = "WhiteSur-light"gtk-font-name = "Cantarell 11"

gtk3 application can edit /usr/share/gtk-3.0/settings.ini or .config/gtk-3.0/settings.ini
cat ~/.config/gtk-3.0/settings.ini [Settings]gtk-cursor-theme-name = oreo_spark_blue_cursorsgtk-icon-theme-name = WhiteSur-lightgtk-theme-name = WhiteSur-lightgtk-font-name = Cantarell 11

then relogin desktop, most of applications will show specified theme correctly. however some of applications such as vbox still the same as before shows like this:

and at last i find that it is because the application writes by QT, so we cannot apply GTK theme to it. and i find the fixed method: make QT application use GTK theme in this page
# write this to ~/.xinitrc if i use window managerexport DESKTOP_SESSION=gnome

relogin desktop, and then the virtualbox shows correct themes, it is really amazing!

only for one specified app
above setting will change all app theme, however we can define some app with specified theme.
# go to this foldercd /usr/share/applications# find which app should be changevim leafpad.desktop# find Exec lineExec=leafpad %F# change it to specified themeExec=env GTK_THEME=WhiteSur-light:light leafpad %F

restart app, theme will make effect. but it seems that it’s only make effect if we have no theme setting by default.
font settingat first, we need to know the category of fonts.

bitmap: often used in system console
latin script:
serif: shows great in large font, no good in small font. often used in title and printing.
sans-serif: shows great in small font and web page.
monospace: often used in coding.
family: include above there fonts.


non-latin script: chinese/japanese and others
emoji and symbols
math
other operating system fonts

so in a GUI operation system, we often use latin for english and non-latin for chinese. emoji and math is optional. notice that console can use bitmap only.

user font can be set in ~/.local/share/fonts
then use fc-cache to build font cache.

in order to configure font manually, we need two step:

 make effect of user setting

   mkdir ~/.config/fontconfig/conf.dln -s /usr/share/fontconfig/conf.avail/50-user.conf ~/.config/fontconfig/conf.d


manually font setting
touch ~/.config/fontconfig/fonts.conf

<?xml version="1.0"?><!DOCTYPE fontconfig SYSTEM "fonts.dtd"><fontconfig>    <match target="font">        <edit name="autohint" mode="assign"> <bool>false</bool> </edit>        <edit name="antialias" mode="assign"> <bool>true</bool> </edit>        <edit name="hinting" mode="assign"> <bool>true</bool> </edit>        <edit name="hintstyle" mode="assign"> <const>hintslight</const> </edit>        <edit name="rgba" mode="assign"> <const>rgb</const> </edit>        <edit name="lcdfilter" mode="assign"> <const>lcddefault</const> </edit>        <edit name="embeddedbitmap" mode="assign"> <bool>false</bool> </edit>    </match>    <!--fallback font order-->    <alias>        <family>serif</family>        <prefer>            <family>DejaVu Serif</family>            <family>Source Han Sans CN</family>        </prefer>    </alias>    <alias>        <family>sans-serif</family>        <prefer>            <family>Inter</family>            <family>Source Han Sans CN</family>        </prefer>    </alias>    <alias>        <family>monospace</family>        <prefer>            <family>Ubuntu</family>            <family>Source Han Sans CN</family>        </prefer>    </alias></fontconfig>

i use DejaVu Serif for serif, Inter for sans-serif, Ubuntu for monospace. the same setting for firefox and it shows great.
virtual machinevirtualboxload kernel module
before we can run virtual machine, we need load vboxdrv kernel module before
modprobe vboxdrv

when we launch a virtualbox os with desktop environment, the most import thing is the size of window, for what the default size is to small.
if we use windows we can directily click the top bar menu and choose install third extension, after finish, we can login windows and click install extension.
screen size with command
however in linux, it is much complex, one method i find good enough is use command to specify to size without install extension and working fine.
# first use cvt to product the screen size infocvt length width# second install xorg-xrandr and use it to set sizepacman -S xorg-xrandr# add the standout of cvt xrandr --newmode # add a new modexrandr --addmode Virtual-1 lengthxwidth_refreshrate# change screen sizexrandr --output Virtual-1 --mode lengthxwidth_refreshrate# for examplecvt 2550 1406xrandr --newmode "2552x1406_60.00"  302.75  2552 2736 3008 3464  1406 1409 1419 1458 -hsync +vsyncxrandr --addmode Virtual-1 2552x1406_60.00xrandr --output Virtual-1 --mode 2552x1406_60.00

screen size with iso file
yeah, there comes another method which work most of the time i find in the website.The most important thing, do not use THE “GUEST  ADDITIONS CD” come along with the Oracle VirtualBox, which you usually  find in the menu “Devices” - “Insert Guest Additions CD Image”. But download the latest VBoxAdditions iso file from the official webpage, mount the image file in your virtual machine and then run the shell file “VBoxLinuxAdditions.run”:
sudo sh  VBoxLinuxAdditions.run

Type in the password when prompted. Restart your virtual machine, then everything should work now.
kvmI have used virtualbox so many years when i first heard of it, it is quiet simple, free and i like it very much. However today when i see DT’s video, he introduces virt-manager to manager virtual machine, i think i need try it. Because kvm is the kernel based virtual machine, its performance may improved a lot then virtualbox. At first we need to know some concept:

kvm: kernel based virtual machine,  provide the ability to start virtual machine.

qemu: machine emulator which can use kvm hypervisor or others. 

libvirt: libs(network, storage and etc), daemon, command utility(virsh)

virt-manager: gui tool for easily build/manage virtual machine.


at first, check whether support kvm
LC_ALL=C lscpu | grep Virtualization

if the output not empty, then we can install the needed tools
# virt-manager includes libvirtpacman -S qemu virt-manager# other tool that libvirtd needpacman -S ebtables dnsmasq dmidecode


Note: 

ebtables and dnsmasq is very important for virt-manager to manage/build host network bridge and dnsmasq in iptables, without them the network in virtual machine may be faild to connect.

dmidecode used for showing host information in virt-manager.

so,  in host machine iptables must be enabled and started for virt-manager to manage virtual machine network.



then enable and start libvirtd daemon
systemctl enable --now libvirtd

after start up, we need add our user to libvirt group. 

 Note: without this step, there may be some auth errors.

usermod -a -G libvirt [user_name]

finally, we can launch virt-manager to build/manage virtual machine.
add new image location
the default image location is /var/lib/libvirt/images, we can add a new storage location via virt-manager

convert virtualbox images to kvm images
# for example convert archlinux.vdi to archlinux# er, i convert serveral images from vdi to qcow2 and all of them faild in find disk with UUIDqemu-img convert -f vdi -O qcow2 archlinux.vdi ~/Public/kvm/images/archlinux

add uefi support
install edk2-ovmf to support uefi
pacman -S edk2-ovmf# then restart libvertdsystemctl restart libvertd

get mouse back from virt-manager
use left ctrl + left alt to release focus in virt-manager. or left ctrl + left alt + g when use GTK fronted of qemu.
some important virsh command
virsh is libvirt’s command line tool, include commands which can operate the virtual machine instead of virt-manager, however it is much complex.
virtual machine is called domain in libvirt

cronie notifyi use cronie to edit time task

in default, cronie use vi to edit task. we can change it vim

there are some principles we need to follow:

message cannot send to dbus directorily
crontab don’t know system variables, we need to announce it
stdout not support pipline
cannot recognize local command such as ~/.local/bin

in order to use notify and sound we need announce variables either in script or crontab command
## sound variable# check variable's valueecho $XDG_RUNTIME_DIR# 1. write in scriptexport XDG_RUNTIME_DIR=/run/user/1000# 2. or announce in crontabenv XDG_RUNTIME_DIR=/run/user/1000## nofify# check variable's valueecho $DBUS_SESSION_BUS_ADDRESS# 1. write in scriptexport DBUS_SESSION_BUS_ADDRESS=unix:path=/run/user/1000/bus# 2. or announce in crontabenv DBUS_SESSION_BUS_ADDRESS=unix:path=/run/user/1000/bus

we can write crontab like this:
* * * * * env DBUS_SESSION_BUS_ADDRESS=unix:path="/run/user/1000/bus" XDG_RUNTIME_DIR="/run/user/1000" dunstify "`~/.local/bin/filesync`"

however, there is a problem. if we send nothing, the dunst will also show a none notify. we can fix it by writing command in script, and then execute script
function log(){    exec 1>&4    if [ $# -gt 0 ];then        info=$@        echo "[$(date '+%F %H:%M')] :: $info"        # send notify in script        dunstify "[$(date '+%F %H:%M')] :: $info"    fi    exec 1>/dev/null    unset info}

then execute script with crontab
* * * * * env DBUS_SESSION_BUS_ADDRESS=unix:path="/run/user/1000/bus" XDG_RUNTIME_DIR="/run/user/1000" ~/.local/bin/filesync
